stories.text:
Title mostly says it all. I'm trying to get myself up to speed to build a pretty complex rails app from scratch, something I've never done before.

I've hired someone to help me, we'll check in every day and share a screen and and talk over the project and I'll get pointers and learn stuff while we work on the same live code together.

I've considered something like Cloud9 to host the development instance, deploying to Heroku for production. But Cloud9 is a little clunky of course so wondering if there's other options people like for live collaboration on actual code, Google Docs style where you're really doing it in real time.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the best setup for remote pair coding in your opinion? (Rails)

stories.text:
Seriously curious about this. USA is the most tech-forward country in the world among a few others.

It has the highest number of doses being already administered to its population and yet the cases of covid are on the rise. Deaths have again started to pickup.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why USA, the most tech-forward country in the world can't control Covid?

stories.text:
Think like most people I've signed up for a bunch of newsletters that I thought I'd read on a regular basis, but that never happened. So now I'm trying to find weekly newsletters that I might actually read.

The topics I'm interested in: national news (US), global news, new memes / Internet culture, pop culture, and sports (US)

Any suggestions would be appreciated.
stories.title: Ask HN: Which weekly newsletters do you subscribe to?
